get.description: This API fetches the preferences of the currently logged in agent.

patch.description: This API updates the preferences of the currently logged in agent.

post.description:
This API sets the profile photo for the currently logged in agent.

Note: To upload your photo generate OAuthToken for the scope: Desk.settings.UPDATE,profile.userphoto.UPDATE or Desk.basic.UPDATE,profile.userphoto.UPDATE

post.summary: Schedule reassignment for deactivated or deleted agents
post.description: This API schedules reassignment of tickets, tasks, and automations belonging to a deleted/deactivated agent to another agent within the same department.

get.description: This API fetches details of agents via the agent IDs passed in the API request.

parameters.name: agentIds
parameters.description: Comma-separated array of agent IDs. Maximum number of IDs allowed is 50.

schema.description: Comma-separated array of agent IDs. Maximum number of IDs allowed is 50.

get.description:
This API gets the profile photo for the given agent id.

Note: To get agent photo generate OAuthToken for the scope: Desk.settings.READ,profile.userphoto.READ or Desk.basic.READ,profile.userphoto.READ

parameters.name: fileSize
parameters.description: Size of the image file to download. Values allowed are @THUMBNAIL@ (image with reduced dimensions and size) and @ACTUAL@ (image with actual dimensions and size). The default value is @ACTUAL@.

schema.description: Size of the image file to download. Values allowed are @THUMBNAIL@ (image with reduced dimensions and size) and @ACTUAL@ (image with actual dimensions and size). The default value is @ACTUAL@.

post.description: This API activates agents in your help desk.
This API removes the identification details of a deleted agent.

get.description: This API lists a particular number of agents, based on the limit specified.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Secondary information related to agents, The allowed values are profile, role. You can include all two values by separating them with commas in the API request.

schema.description: Secondary information related to agents, The allowed values are @profile@, @role@. You can include all two values by separating them with commas in the API request.

parameters.name: roleIds
parameters.description: Comma-separated array of role IDs. Maximum number of IDs allowed is 50.

schema.description: Comma-separated array of role IDs. Maximum number of IDs allowed is 50.

x-custom-parameters-attributes: Comma-separated array of role IDs. Maximum number of IDs allowed is 50.

parameters.name: searchStr
parameters.description: String to search for agents by first name, last name, or email ID. The string must contain at least one character. The supported search methods: 1) string* - Searches for agents whose first name, last name, or email ID start with the string, 2) *string* - Searches for agents whose first name, last name, or email ID contain the string, 3) string - Searches for agents whose first name, last name, or email ID is an exact match for the string

schema.description: String to search for agents by first name, last name, or email ID. The string must contain at least one character. The supported search methods: 1) string* - Searches for agents whose first name, last name, or email ID start with the string, 2) *string* - Searches for agents whose first name, last name, or email ID contain the string, 3) string - Searches for agents whose first name, last name, or email ID is an exact match for the string

parameters.name: cfSearchStr
parameters.description: String to search for agents by custom field. The string must contain at least one character

parameters.name: cfFieldName
parameters.description: API name of the custom field that must be used for searching and listing agents

parameters.name: fieldName
parameters.description: Name of the field that must be used for searching and listing agents. The allowed values are: @firstName@, @lastName@, @name@, and @emailId@

schema.description: Name of the field that must be used for searching and listing agents. The allowed values are: @firstName@, @lastName@, @name@, and @emailId@

parameters.name: departmentId
parameters.description: IDs of the departments to which the agent belongs

schema.description: ID of the department from which the agents must be fetched

parameters.name: rolePermissionType
parameters.description: Types of roles and permissions of the agents to list. The allowed values are @AgentPublic@, @AgentPersonal@,@AgentTeamPersonal@, @Admin@, @Light@, @Custom@, and @${NON_LIGHT}@. @${NON_LIGHT}@ refers to agents who are not associated with the light agent profile.

schema.description: Types of roles and permissions of the agents to list. The allowed values are @AgentPublic@, @AgentPersonal@,@AgentTeamPersonal@, @Admin@, @Light@, @Custom@, and @${NON_LIGHT}@. @${NON_LIGHT}@ refers to agents who are not associated with the light agent profile.

parameters.name: profileIds
parameters.description: Comma-separated array of profile IDs. Maximum number of IDs allowed is 50.

schema.description: Comma-separated array of profile IDs. Maximum number of IDs allowed is 50.

x-custom-parameters-attributes: Comma-separated array of profile IDs. Maximum number of IDs allowed is 50.

parameters.name: departmentIds
parameters.description: Comma-separated array of department IDs. Maximum number of IDs allowed is 50.

schema.description: Comma-separated array of department IDs. Maximum number of IDs allowed is 50.

x-custom-parameters-attributes: Comma-separated array of department IDs. Maximum number of IDs allowed is 50.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Filters agents based on their type.The allowed values are @humanAgent@ , @ziaAgent@ . humanAgent: Returns only human agents. ziaAgent: Returns only Zia agents. Note: If no filter is applied, both human and Zia agents will be returned.

schema.description: Filters agents based on their type.The allowed values are @humanAgent@ , @ziaAgent@ . humanAgent: Returns only human agents. ziaAgent: Returns only Zia agents. Note: If no filter is applied, both human and Zia agents will be returned.

parameters.name: updateTimeGT
parameters.description: Key that filters agents added/confirmed/updated after a specific time. Enter a date in the ISO date format of yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ss.SSSZ.

schema.description: Key that filters agents added/confirmed/updated after a specific time. Enter a date in the ISO date format of yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ss.SSSZ.

post.description:
This API adds an agent to your help desk.


Keep in mind the following points while adding an agent:

  1. TheemailId,lastName,associatedDepartmentIds, and rolePermissionType are mandatory in the API request.
  2. To assign the profile and role for the agents, pass any of the following values with the rolePermissionType key:
    1. For the Support Administrator profile and CEO role, pass "rolePermissionType":"Admin"
    2. For the Agent profile and public role, pass "rolePermissionType":"AgentPublic"
    3. For the Agent profile and personal role, pass "rolePermissionType":"AgentPersonal"
    4. For custom profiles and roles, pass "rolePermissionType":"Custom" and "roleId":"<actual role ID>", "profileId":"<actual profile ID>"
    5. For the light agent profile and role, pass "rolePermissionType":"Light"
    6. For the Agent profile and Personal Team role, pass "rolePermissionType":"AgentTeamPersonal"

get.description: This API fetches details of the currently logged in agent.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Secondary information related to the agent. Values allowed are profile, role, associatedDepartments, and associatedChatDepartments. You can pass multiple values by separating them with commas in the query param

schema.description: Secondary information related to the agent. Values allowed are @profile@, @role@, @associatedDepartments@, and @associatedChatDepartments@. You can pass multiple values by separating them with commas in the query param

get.description: This API lists total number of agent,light agent license count and used license count for the portal
This API lists confirmed agents, based on the last fetched time specified.

parameters.name: lastFetchedTime
parameters.description: Key that filters agents after a specific time. Enter a date in the ISO date format of yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ss.SSSZ.

schema.description: Key that filters agents after a specific time. Enter a date in the ISO date format of yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ss.SSSZ.

parameters.description: Number of bulk record already fetched

schema.description: Number of bulk record already fetched

get.description: This API fetches details of an agent in your help desk.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Secondary information related to the agent. Values allowed are profile, role, associatedDepartments, associatedChatDepartments and verifiedEmails. You can include all four values by separating them with commas in the API request.

schema.description: Secondary information related to the agent. Values allowed are @profile@, @role@, @associatedDepartments@, @associatedChatDepartments@ and @verifiedEmails@. You can include all four values by separating them with commas in the API request.

patch.description: This API updates details of an agent.

post.description: This API deactivates an agent in your help desk.

get.description: This API lists all type of agents count
This API returns details of the resources with which an agent is associated. These resources include tickets and tasks assigned to the agent and integrations configured by the agent.

post.description: This API deletes the profile photo of the currently logged in agent.
This API is used for adding upto 10 users in one request.
This API deletes unconfirmed agents from your help desk.

parameters.description: Count light agent.

agentIds.descrption: Comma-separated array of agent IDs. Maximum number of IDs allowed is 50.

langCode.descrption: Language code of the agent. Agents can update only their langCode. They cannot update the langCode of other users.

timeZone.descrption: The timeZone of the agent. Eg Asia/Calcutta, Europe/Moscow. One can update his own timeZone only. If it is passed for other agent it will be ignored.

zuid.descrption: Zoho user ID of the agent

photoURL.descrption: URL of the image file displaying the agent's photo

countryCode.descrption: Country code of the agent. Agents can update only their countryCode. They cannot update the countryCode of other users.

rolePermissionType.descrption: The Role Permission type of Agent

isConfirmed.descrption: Key that returns if the agent is a confirmed user in the portal or not

status.descrption: Activation status of the agent: @ACTIVE@ or @DISABLED@
